title.narrative: Feasibility Study - 58 MW Combined Biomass and Hydroelectric Renewable Energy Park, through Government of Chile

description.narrative: This $607,000 feasibility study is assessing the economic, commercial, and environmental feasibility of a 58 megawatt (MW) renewable energy park on a 24,000 acre plot of land near Mulchen, Chile, consisting of an 18 MW biomass energy plant, a 33 MW hydroelectric plant, and a 7 MW small hydroelectric plant, and is preparing a conceptual engineering design for the park.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - 99 MW Tablaruca Wind Farm on Chiloe Island, through Government of Chile

description.narrative: USTDA is providing $610,000 in grant funding to support a feasibility study to determine the technical, economic, financial, and environmental viability of a wind farm of approximately 99 megawatts (MW) on the island of Chiloe. The grantee is Empresa Eolica Tablaruca S.A (Tablaruca Wind Company or Tablaruca).

description.narrative: Feasibility Study - Low-Head Hydropower Project Portfolio, through Government of Chile

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Low-Head Hydropower Project Portfolio, through Government of Chile

description.narrative: This $721,657 feasibility study entails the selection of two low-head hydro projects (Pilot Projects) from a total of four potential sites based on economics and implementation timeframe. The study will conduct assessments and include the engineering designs of the two selected Pilot Projects, as well as identify a portfolio of 50-150 megawatts (Portfolio) of additional low-head hydropower projects and evaluate their viability. The grantee is Telecommunicaciones y Energia, Wireless Energy (Chile) Ltda. (Wireless Energy), an experienced alternative energy project developer based in Puerto Montt in southern Chile. U.S. company Natel Energy, Inc. (Alameda, CA) is the sole-source contractor for this activity. Natel Energy is a U.S. manufacturer that has developed and patented a turbine (hydroEngine TM) for low-head sites that would be used in the hydro plants to be developed by Wireless Energy.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Puerto Natales 5 MW Biomass Energy Plant, through Government of Chile

description.narrative: This $484,000 feasibility study grant supports the development of a 5 megawatt (MW) biomass energy plant in Puerto Natales, Chile. The technology options to be assessed are combined heat and power (CHP) and biomass gasification. The feasibility study is assisting Monte Alto Forestal S.A. (MAFSA) in assessing the technical, economic, financial, and environmental feasibility of a biomass plant expected to use biomass resources from MAFSA's forestry operations.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - San Antonio Santiago Intermodal Corridor, through Government of Chile

description.narrative: This $620,000 grant supports a feasibility study to analyze the technical and financial aspects of implementing the proposed San Antonio-Santiago Intermodal Corridor (Project) in Chile. The grantee is the Empresa Portuaria de San Antonio (Port Company of San Antonio or EPSA), a government-owned company responsible for overseeing the development and operation of the port of San Antonio. The objective of the Project is to achieve maximum efficiency for containerized cargo movements through the port of San Antonio and intermodal facilities in the Santiago metropolitan area, with support for EPSA and the cargo handling capabilities of other public and private sector stakeholders. The proposed Project is expected to significantly enhance Chiles economic development and lessen the environmental impact of its cargo transport by transporting more by rail rather than by truck.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

sector.narrative: Electric power transmission and distribution (centralised grids)

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - National Emergency Backbone Network, through Government of Chile

description.narrative: USTDA is providing $514,548 in grant funding to provide technical assistance to the Subsecretariat of Telecommunications to develop a National Emergency Backbone Network (NEBN) in Chile. The objective of the NEBN is to improve coordination and response to natural and man-made disasters. The NEBN will enable the currently disparate systems of various public-safety organizations to interoperate. The grantee, the Subsecretariat of Telecommunications, will oversee the planning and acquisition of the system.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Port Operational Enhancement Technologies, through Meridian International Center

description.narrative: The Port Operational Enhancement Technologies Reverse Trade Mission brought officials from Chile on a visit to the United States to familiarize them with the latest available port modernization technologies, including logistics management software and port security systems. This visit included meetings with U.S. suppliers as well as site visits to relevant U.S. ports.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - AEROSPACE SYSTEMS, FACILITIES, AND SAFETY AND SECURITY IMPROVEMENTS, through Government of Chile

description.narrative: USTDA is providing a $351,200 Feasibility Study grant to the Airports Director (DAP) in Chile. DAP has requested assistance in creating a Master Plan that will guide the modernization and development of Balmaceda Airport in order to accommodate existing and future demand.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - DEVELOPMENT OF DIGITAL TRUNKING TECHNOLOGY, through Government of Chile

description.narrative: USTDA is providing funding, in an amount not to exceed $436,000, for a feasibility study grant to Gallyas S.A. of Chile (Gallyas). The study will enable Gallyas to upgrade from an analog to a digital technology trunking platform. The feasibility study addresses the technical, commercial, legal/regulatory and organizational aspects of the digital technology trunking migration process.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - AIR NAVIGATION TECHNOLOGIES REVERSE TRADE MISSION, through Millennium Science & Engineering, Inc.

description.narrative: This $69,000 reverse trade mission familiarizes representatives from Chile's Civil General Aviation Directorate (Direccion General de Aeronautica Civil, DGAC) with the development, implementation, and regulation of Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Broadcast (ADS-B) and Local Area Augmentation System (LAAS) airspace technologies.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Punta Arenas Coal Gasification, through The Webster Group

description.narrative: This reverse trade mission (RTM) familiarized Chilean delegates with U.S. technologies for coal gasification. The RTM provided the delegation with information for the development of a coal gasification facility at Mina Invierno in southern Chile. The delegation visited coal gasification facilities in operation in the United States and met with U.S. technology suppliers.
